summary:
Carbon is a non-metallic element with the symbol C and atomic number 6. It can form up to four chemical bonds and is found in group 14 of the periodic table. Carbon is relatively rare in Earth's crust but is the fourth most abundant element in the universe. It's crucial for life due to its ability to create diverse organic compounds and polymers.

Carbon has several forms (allotropes), like graphite (soft and black) and diamond (hard and transparent). It can be found in nature as stable isotopes (12C, 13C) and a radioactive one (14C). Carbon compounds are everywhere, with over 200 million described!
title: Carbon
